channel.title: Object deletion question
channel.description:
Can you delete an object that is floating about? Like I deleted the objects below the floating object, for an example a house with a ladder. I deleted the bottom part of the house but when I rotate my camera it shows the top part of the house like at the Grand Tree. Is it possible to delete that top part? I'm using a delta source btw.
EDIT: Also, is it possible to create your own tile? Like your in water and spawn land tile, is that possible? :eek:

item.title: Object deletion question
item.dc:creator: @Kidpaparoach Kidpaparoach
item.description:
@Kidpaparoach wrote:

Before I even comment on this I want you to know I don’t do Delta. I also have not that much experience with RSPS.

You should try it regardless of asking me. Worst case scenario it doesn’t work and you can restore it.
I believe theirs a cache editor you can use for that type of thing also.

Read full topic

item.title: Object deletion question
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“Asglv, post:3, topic:477969”][quote author=Kidpaparoach link=topic=596166.msg4197466#msg4197466 date=1357720500]
Programming logic:
If their is something in the programme you are running then their must be a piece of code making it happen. Remove the code and it wont exist [deletion in your case], add it in and it will exist.
[/quote]
You should be deleting walls with delete walls, and deleting objects with delete objects…
And yes, you need to remove the objects that’s on the upper floors.

Okay I understand that. I’m at the “Deletewalls” under the client.java and I deleted the bottom half of this house. But, it still shows the top half when rotating the camera. I am wondering how to delete that top half. Should I just climb the ladder and delete the top half?[/quote]

Read full topic
